    Using a GPT2 transformer model to get word predictability.
  • Changelog

    Get a matrix with the log probabilities of possible word given its previous context using a causal transformer

    get_causal_log_prob_mat.Rd

    Get a matrix with the log probabilities of possible word given its previous context using a causal transformer model from Hugging Face.

    Usage

    get_causal_log_prob_mat(
  x,
  .by = rep(1, length(x)),
  model = "gpt2",
  add_bos_token = NULL,
  stride = 1,
  config_model = NULL,
  config_tokenizer = NULL
)

    Arguments

    x

    Vector of words, phrases or texts.

    .by

    Vector that indicates how the text should be split.

    model

    Name of a pretrained model stored on the huggingface.co. (Maybe a path to a model (.pt or .bin file) stored locally will work.)

    add_bos_token

    Whether to include beginning of text special tokens. By default acts as the AutoTokenizer.

    config_model

    List with other arguments that control how the model from hugging face is accessed.

    config_tokenizer

    List with arguments that control how the tokenizer from hugging face is accessed.

    Value

    A matrix.

    Details

    For more about causal models, see (https://huggingface.co/course/chapter7/6). Using the config_model and config_tokenizer arguments, it's possible to control how the model and tokenizer from hugging face is accessed, see from_pretrained for details. In case of errors check the status of https://status.huggingface.co/

    On this page
